    • mcsim: metacommunity simulation

    Simulate metacommunity dynamics

    mcsim.Rd

    Simulate metacommunity dynamics

    mcsim(
  n_species = 5,
  n_patch = 5,
  n_warmup = 200,
  n_burnin = 200,
  n_timestep = 1000,
  propagule_interval = NULL,
  carrying_capacity = 100,
  interaction_type = "constant",
  alpha = 0,
  min_alpha = NULL,
  max_alpha = NULL,
  r0 = 4,
  niche_optim = NULL,
  min_optim = -1,
  max_optim = 1,
  sd_niche_width = NULL,
  min_niche_width = 0.1,
  max_niche_width = 1,
  niche_cost = 1,
  xy_coord = NULL,
  distance_matrix = NULL,
  dispersal_matrix = NULL,
  landscape_size = 10,
  mean_env = 0,
  sd_env = 0.1,
  spatial_env_cor = FALSE,
  phi = 1,
  p_dispersal = 0.1,
  theta = 1,
  plot = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    n_species

    numeric value. Number of species in a metacommunity.

    n_patch

    numeric value. Number of patches in a metacommunity.

    n_warmup

    numeric value. Number of time-steps for warm-up. Default 200.

    n_burnin

    numeric value. Number of time-steps for burn-in. Default 200.

    n_timestep

    numeric value. Number of time-steps to be saved. Default 1000.

    propagule_interval

    numeric value. Time interval for propagule introduction during warm-up. If NULL, a value of ceiling(n_warmup / 10) will be used.

    carrying_capacity

    numeric value (length should be one or equal to n_patch). Carrying capacities of individual patches. Default 100.

    interaction_type

    character string. "constant" or "random". "constant" assumes the unique interaction strength of alpha for all pairs of species. "random" draws random numbers from a uniform distribution with min_alpha and max_alpha.

    alpha

    numeric value. Species interaction strength. Enabled if interaction_type = "constant". Default 0.

    min_alpha

    numeric value. Minimum value of a uniform distribution that generates species interaction strength. Enabled if interaction_type = "random". Default NULL.

    max_alpha

    numeric value. Maximum value of a uniform distribution that generates species interaction strength. Enabled if interaction_type = "random". Default NULL.

    r0

    numeric value (length should be one or equal to n_species). Maximum reproductive number of the Beverton-Holt model.

    niche_optim

    numeric value (length should be one or equal to n_species). Niche optimum of species (environmental value that maximizes the reproductive number). Default NULL.

    min_optim

    numeric value. Minimum value of a uniform distribution that generates optimal environmental values of simulated species. Values are randomly assigned to species. Enabled if niche_optim = NULL.

    max_optim

    numeric value. Maximum value of a uniform distribution that generates optimal environmental values of simulated species. Values are randomly assigned to species. Enabled if niche_optim = NULL.

    sd_niche_width

    numeric value (length should be one or equal to n_species). Niche width of species. Higher values indicate greater niche width.

    min_niche_width

    numeric value. Minimum value of a uniform distribution that generates niche width values of simulated species. Values are randomly assigned to species. Enabled if sd_niche_width = NULL.

    max_niche_width

    numeric value. Maximum value of a uniform distribution that generates niche width values of simulated species. Values are randomly assigned to species. Enabled if sd_niche_width = NULL.

    niche_cost

    numeric value. Determine the cost of wide niche (smaller values imply greater costs of wider niche). Default 1.

    xy_coord

    data frame. Each row should correspond to an individual patch, with x and y coordinates (columns). Defualt NULL.

    distance_matrix

    numeric value. Distance matrix indicating distance between habitat patches. If provided, the distance matrix will be used to generate dispersal matrix and to calculate distance decay of environmental correlations. Default NULL.

    dispersal_matrix

    numeric value. Dispersal matrix to be used to simulate dispersal process. Override distance_matrix. Default NULL.

    landscape_size

    numeric value. Length of a landscape on a side. Enabled if dispersal_matrix = NULL.

    mean_env

    numeric value (length should be one or equal to n_patch). Mean environmental values of patches.

    sd_env

    numeric value. Standard deviation of temporal environmental variation at each patch.

    spatial_env_cor

    logical. If TRUE, spatial autocorrelation in temporal environmental fluctuation is considered. Default FALSE.

    phi

    numeric value. A parameter describing the distance decay of spatial autocorrelation in temporal environmental fluctuation. Enabled if spatial_env_cor = TRUE.

    p_dispersal

    numeric value (length should be one or equal to n_species). Probability of dispersal.

    theta

    numeric value. Dispersal parameter describing dispersal capability of species.

    plot

    logical. If TRUE, five sample patches and species of df_dynamics are plotted.

    Value

    df_dynamics data frame containing simulated metacommunity dynamics. df_species data frame containing species attributes. df_patch data frame containing patch attributes. df_diversity data frame containing diversity metrics. alpha and gamma diversities were averaged over the simulation time steps (n_timestep). beta diversity is calculated as gamma / alpha.

    Reference

    see github page for instruction

    Author

    Akira Terui, hanabi0111@gmail.com

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
# not run
mcsim(n_patch = 5, n_species = 5)
}
